title: LK-HUB Partners with Ministry of Education
content: We are thrilled to announce a strategic partnership with the Ministry of Education to enhance media literacy curriculums across high schools.

title: Annual Youth Leadership Summit Announced
content: Join us for our biggest event of the year where young leaders from across the region gather to solve tomorrow's challenges.

title: Saleh Kamel School Hosts ELHAM Campaign Visit
content:
At LK-HUB, we believe that empowering young minds is where true transformation begins. As proud sponsors of the ELHAM campaign, we continue to support initiatives that empower girls in technical education.


Saleh Kamel Applied Technology School hosted an inspiring visit as part of the campaign's activities. During the visit, students explored key concepts in entrepreneurship and marketing through engaging presentations and interactive activities.


Students participated in sessions such as "Market It Right" and "Fictional Products," and took part in a creative competition on how to market their school with new ideasâ€”encouraging critical thinking, innovation, and teamwork.

title: Media Mastery for Medical Minds Workshop
content:
A glimpse into the Media Mastery for Medical Minds Workshop, led by LK-HUB in collaboration with the Arab-German Young Academy (AGYA).


In this session, Dr. Heba El Shahid, Adjunct Assistant Professor at AUC's Journalism and Mass Communication Department, introduced the SOS method: Stop. Observe. Speculate. A simple yet powerful framework that invites us to pause, read between the lines, and respond with intention.


As pioneers in media literacy education, we don't just teach people how to consume mediaâ€”we empower them to decode it, challenge it, and use it as a tool for influence. At LK-HUB, we insist on equipping individuals and institutions with the mindset, tools, and confidence to navigate complexity.

title: Sponsorship of 'No Screens, No Social Media Day' Initiative
content:
ğŸ“¢ LK-HUB is proud to sponsor the #NoScreens_NoSocialMedia_Day initiative


As part of our pioneering role in promoting Media Literacy in Egypt since 2020, we are honored to sponsor the "No Screens, No Social Media Day" initiative, announced by Prof. Dr. Mona El-Hadidi, which officially launched on September 25, 2025.


Media literacy has been at the core of our work over the past years â€” through dozens of workshops and awareness programs designed for children and youth â€” emphasizing the importance of responsible technology use.


We believe this initiative aligns with our shared vision of promoting digital responsibility, restoring balance between the virtual world and real life, and protecting young generations from excessive screen use.

title: Launch of Federation of Egyptian Banks Applied Technology School Campus
content:
ğŸš€ A bold step forward in technical education excellence.


We are proud to announce the launch of the Federation of Egyptian Banks Applied Technology School Campus in Helwan â€“ Cairo Governorate, starting the academic year 2025â€“2026. It is the largest applied technology campus in Egypt hosting 4 majors, purpose-built to bridge the gap between technical education and real industry needs.


The campus is rooted in four high-demand industrial sectors:

  • ğŸ”¹ Mold Manufacturing
  • ğŸ”¹ Ready-Made Garments
  • ğŸ”¹ Metal Forming and Machining
  • ğŸ”¹ Pharmaceutical Industries

As the academic partner, LK-HUB is leading the management and operation of the campus, ensuring high-quality educational standards and work-based learning.


This milestone is made possible by a visionary partnership with the Federation of Egyptian Banks and the Federation of Egyptian Industries.

title: Opening of Banque Misr Applied Technology School
content:
A new chapter in future-driven education begins.


We are proud to announce the opening of the Banque Misr Applied Technology School for Supply Chain and Mechatronics in Obour City â€“ Qalyubia Governorate, starting academic year 2025â€“2026. This marks the launch of the first specialized applied technology school in these two essential sectors.


As the academic partner responsible for managing and operating the school, LK-HUB is honored to lead this milestone in collaboration with the Federation of Egyptian Industries and Banque Misr.


This school is more than a new academic offeringâ€”it's a model for advanced technical education that links high-quality curricula with real-world training and institutional partnerships.

title: Saleh Kamel School Celebrates Excellence! ğŸŒŸ
content:
Top Achievers of the First Academic Year: Saleh Kamel School Celebrates Excellence! ğŸŒŸ


As the academic partner responsible for managing and operating Saleh Kamel Applied Technology School for Readymade Garments and Textile, LK-HUB proudly congratulates the top-performing students of the school's first academic year.


This success reflects more than academic resultsâ€”it tells a story of commitment, growth, and determination that defined this pioneering cohort from day one.


This moment reaffirms our commitment to building serious, purpose-driven learning environments that empower students to excel earlyâ€”and lead long after.

title: Dr. Lobna Khairy on 'Kowetha fi Sane'tha' Podcast
content:
Our very own CEO, Dr. Lobna Khairy recently shared her valuable insights on the Elham Campaign Podcast "Kowetha fi Sane'tha".


As a dedicated member of the National Council for Women Media Committee, Dr. Lobna eloquently addressed the vital role of media in supporting and reshaping the future of vocational education for girls in Egypt.


Her discussion shed light on how inclusive media can actively challenge deeply ingrained stereotypes, empower young women, and pave the way for meaningful engagement in entrepreneurship and technical sectors.


At LK-HUB, our commitment extends beyond creating content. We firmly believe in liberating knowledge â€“ a force that has the power to transform individual lives and entire communities.

title: Sponsorship of 'ELHAM' Campaign
content:
At LK-HUB, we take pride in sponsoring "ELHAM", a student-led campaign launched by aspiring changemakers from 6th of October University.


Rooted in purpose and vision, this social campaign shines a spotlight on girls in technical educationâ€”not just to support their path, but to amplify their potential to innovate, create, and lead in spaces where their voices are still growing.


This partnership aligns with what we believe in: education that empowers, and platforms that allow young women to challenge expectations and rewrite what's possible. We're proud to stand behind a generation that dares to imagineâ€”and act.

title: Award for Excellence
content:
LK-HUB received the "Excellence in Capacity Building" award for our contributions to continuous development. The award recognizes our impactful training programs and workshops that have helped thousands of professionals enhance their skills.


We are honored to be recognized by the industry for our dedication to quality and impact. This award motivates us to continue striving for excellence in all our endeavors.

title: Launch of LK-Solutions
content:
We are excited to unveil LK-Solutions, our new division dedicated to providing integrated technological and media solutions. LK-Solutions will offer a suite of services including media management, content creation, and custom digital platform development.


This new division answers the growing demand for comprehensive digital transformation services in the market. By leveraging our deep expertise in media and technology, we help businesses and organizations streamline their operations and amplify their message.

title: Partnership with UNICEF
content:
LK-HUB is proud to announce a renewed partnership with UNICEF to expand media literacy programs across the region. This collaboration aims to reach over 10,000 students in the coming year, providing them with essential skills to navigate the digital world safely and critically.


The program will include workshops, interactive sessions, and the distribution of educational materials in schools across several governorates. Our joint mission is to empower the next generation with the tools they need to be responsible digital citizens.


"This partnership represents a significant milestone in our commitment to education and development," said the CEO of LK-HUB.
